ngiemboon: N deen ńké ńgyá lefaŋ sesẅé mbɔɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ yesẅé. Mbà ndùŋmvfò lefaŋ mbɔɔ ndùŋmvfò ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ kéen ḿmag, mbɔɔ ntse tépàa cʉ́ʼʉ wó wɔ́.
en: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth;   for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away,  # 21:1 Lk 21:33; 1Co 7:31; 2Pt 3:10 and the sea was no more.  # 21:1 Is 57:20; Rv 13:1,6–7

ngiemboon: M biŋ ńgyá tÿǒsoŋo Ndʉalʉ̌a, á Yelúzálèm yesẅé, á ne fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé ésẅɛ́ʼɛ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ nzwěngʉ̀ gẅie à kẅǐŋ mbùm ye ńne ńzẅíʼte ndúm we la.
en: I also saw the holy city,   the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,  # 21:2 Gl 4:26; Php 3:20; Heb 11:10; 12:22; 13:14; Rv 3:12 prepared like a bride adorned for her husband.  # 21:2 Is 61:10; Rv 19:7

ngiemboon: N júʼ etsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ̂ fó jʉʼʉ lʉŋe lefùɔ ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà jʉʼ gie Ssé néŋe wó, á gwɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Pâ pɔ̌ zɔ̌ ge cʉ́ʼʉ néŋe, pɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé, à gwɔ́ Ssé yɔb.
en: Then I heard a loud voice   from the throne:  # 21:3 Other mss read from heaven,# 21:3 Mt 19:28 Look, God’s dwelling  # 21:3 Or tent, ortabernacle is with humanity, and he will live with them. They will be his peoples,  # 21:3 Other mss read people,# 21:3 Lv 26:11–12; Jr 7:23; 30:22; 31:33; Ezk 37:27; Hs 2:23; Zch 8:8 and God himself will be with them and will be their God.  # 21:3 Other mss omit and will be their God

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo tsíʼi ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b ntsèm. Legwé te gÿo gíŋ gwɔ́ wó wɔ́. Mé le gíŋ ńdʉa legwé wɔ́. Mé le gíŋ ńgaʼte wɔ́. Mé le gíŋ ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ wɔ́. Á nue nzẅìŋe ngwòŋ kéen ḿmag.»
en: He will wipe away every tear from their eyes.   Death will be no more;  # 21:4 Hs 13:14; 1Co 15:54 grief, crying, and pain will be no more,  # 21:4 Is 60:20 because the previous things  # 21:4 Or the first things have passed away.  # 21:4 Is 42:9; 2Co 5:17

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ gíŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn n ne ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ pɔ́ sẅé sẅé.» Ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Ŋweʼe. Á nue nò yɔɔn té gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ júʼ ḿmʉ́ʼte wɔ́, áa nénʉ́.»
en: Then the one seated on the throne said, “Look, I am making everything new.” He also said, “Write, because these words   are faithful and true.”  # 21:5 Rv 3:14; 19:11; 22:6

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋ ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Á zsoté. N gee Álefà, ńgwɔ́ Omégà, ńgwɔ́ ndùŋmvfò, ńgwɔ́ nzsònzèm. Agága nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne shÿó, mbà n ge ná ntse gẅie é gÿo mé ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó á mbwó yé. Wɛ̌ ntse fóo na lesaʼá ntse sɔ́ɔn, n ge ná pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: Then he said to me, “It is done!   I am the Alpha and the Omega,  # 21:6 Rv 1:8; 22:13 the beginning and the end.  # 21:6 Is 44:6; 48:12 I will freely give to the thirsty  # 21:6 Ps 42:1–2; Is 41:17; 44:3; 55:1; Jn 4:14; 7:37 from the spring of the water of life.  # 21:6 Ps 36:9; Jr 2:13; Jn 4:14

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à mǎʼ ncù tà ńcʉa nò tepòŋ, n ge gÿo náa yɛ̌ fùʼ mbwó yé, é gwɔ́ Ssé ye, à gwɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn.
en: The one who conquers   will inherit these things, and I will be his God, and he will be my son.  # 21:7 2Sm 7:14

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńgʉa na metsǒŋ, mbɔɔ na pazẅíŋ ḿbiŋ ńdʉʼ, mbɔɔ na pagÿo menò ncÿǒ, mbɔɔ na pazẅéte pʉ̀a, mbɔɔ na pagÿo menò mpfwɔ̀ʼ, mbɔɔ na pagẅiin mekàŋ, mbɔɔ na paguʼte shúm ngie ee Ssé, ńgÿo megàŋa cÿɔ̌nò metsèm, mbà yɔ́b mmó gie mé ge gÿo lɔg tsɔ́ʼɔ fàʼ yɔ́b, áa páʼ mé ge gÿo maʼa wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ lepÿé mmɔ̌g mekʉ̀a, à lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lekwé ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a.»
en: But the cowards, faithless,   detestable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars  # 21:8 Rm 1:28–32; 1Co 6:9–10; Rv 22:15  #— #their share will be in the lake that burns with fire and sulfur,  # 21:8 Rv 19:20 which is the second death.”  # 21:8 Rv 20:6

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé piŋ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé sɔɔnmbʉ́a pie é la kúʼte mentúʼ mɛ̌ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, menzsònzèm mengʉ̀ngʉ̀ sɔɔnmbʉ́a gwɔ́ tsoló tà ńdúe la, ńtó púʼu, ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Tóo, N nyɛɛ gú nzwěngʉ̀, á nzwě múɔ njʉ̀njÿò.»
en: Then one of the seven angels, who had held the seven bowls filled with the seven last plagues,   came and spoke with me: “Come, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, à Zẅìge jʉʉ wɔ́ɔn, ńkaa wɔ́ɔn ńdɔg ńgʉa ndùm tsɔ̌ máamáa lekwɛ́, ńtÿɔ́g, é sag ńgʉa tÿǒ tɛʼ, ńdeen ńké ńnyɛɛ wɔ́ɔn tÿǒsoŋ ndʉalʉ̌a, á Yelúzálèm. Á ne fóo tÿǒ lepwó á lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, ésẅɛ́ʼɛ.
en: He then carried me away in the Spirit  ,# 21:10 Rv 1:10; 4:2; 17:3 to a great, high mountain  # 21:10 Ezk 40:2 and showed me the holy city, Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,

ngiemboon: Shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie à laa mǒ, à laa we Ssé, ńne ńgÿo á ŋwʉŋe páʼ tsɔ́ ntí tɔgɔ́tsye, páʼ tɔgɔ́tsye gie mé tóŋo lê jasepe, ńtele tele páʼ ngalásè la.
en: arrayed with God’s glory.   Her radiance was like a precious jewel, like a jasper stone, clear as crystal.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà mé ka pwóon tàʼ shʉ̀a tʉ̂ankáʼ gẅie à gʉa tÿǒ, ńdɔg ńkéle. Á gẅiin mencwònkáʼ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém. Tàʼ cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé tyé na wɛ̌ ncwò wɔ́ɔ, ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ. Mbà mé la ŋweʼe mezíŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a mǒ, é gwɔ́ mezíŋ mengẅɛ̀ púɔ Ésàlayɛ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém.
en: The city had a massive high wall, with twelve gates. Twelve angels were at the gates; the names of the twelve tribes of Israel’s sons were inscribed on the gates.

ngiemboon: Á laa shÿó sǎʼnèm mencwònkáʼ gwɔ́ méntá, ńgwɔ́ shÿó twó, mencwònkáʼ gwɔ́ méntá, ńgwɔ́ shÿó ntsíŋ mencwònkáʼ gwɔ́ méntá, ńgwɔ́ shÿó mbyěnèm, mencwònkáʼ gwɔ́ méntá.
en: There were three gates on the east, three gates on the north, three gates on the south, and three gates on the west.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔg memǎa metǒon ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém ńnuŋe ncwò tʉ̂ankáʼ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ, mbɔɔ wɛ̌ tóon wɔ́ɔ, á gẅiin lezíŋ tàʼ nyìŋ á na megàŋntúm Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò pie é laa ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém.
en: The city wall had twelve foundations, and the twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb were on the foundations.

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à la ne ńgɔɔn nò né mèŋ, á gẅiin kème mmó gie mé lɔgɔ fʉʼʉ mmó, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, á ne ńge lɔg fʉʼʉ tÿǒsoŋ, éfʉʼ mencwò, éfʉʼ mbɔɔ tʉ̂ankáʼ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ.
en: The one who spoke with me had a golden measuring rod   to measure the city, its gates, and its wall.  # 21:15 Ezk 40:3

ngiemboon: Atÿǒsoŋ la gẅiin meshÿó lekùɔ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ. Ntyě pɔ́ lepfòm gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ. Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé lɔgɔ kème mmó ya, éfʉʼʉ tÿǒsoŋ, á gwɔ́ mmó mekílòmítà, ntsáʼ pʉ́a lé nkÿo pʉ́a (2 200 km). Ntyě pɔ́ lepfòm mbɔɔ lekwɔ̌ʼ ńgʉa tÿǒ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ tàʼa mmó.
en: The city is laid out in a square; its length and width are the same. He measured the city with the rod at 12,000 stadia.   Its length, width, and height are equal.

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé fʉʼʉ tʉ̂ankáʼ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ, léfó ssé ńtyé tÿǒ, á gwɔ́ mmó mítà móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a (70 m), mbà à lɔ̌g fʉ̀ʼ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ fʉʼʉ mmó fʉʼó, éfʉʼ.
en: Then he measured its wall, 144 cubits according to human measurement, which the angel used.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔgɔ tsɔ́ tɔgɔ́tsye ḿbwóon tʉ̂ankáʼ, mé tóŋo yɛ̌ ntí tɔgɔ́tsye lê Jasepe, ntí ngɔ̂ɔ gie mé la lɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ, é gwɔ́, atsɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ té mǒ wɔ́, é tele tele páʼ ngalásè.
en: The building material of its wall was jasper, and the city was pure gold clear as glass.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔg ntí ntí metɔgɔ́tsye ńkẅiŋ memǎa metǒon mie mé la lɔg ńnuŋe mecÿó tʉ̂ankáʼ gẅie à la kéle tÿǒsoŋ. Ndùŋmvfò cÿó, mé lɔg tsɔ̌ ntí tɔgɔ́tsye gie mé tóŋ lê jasepe, ńkẅiŋ, mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, mé lɔg tsɔ́ ntí tɔgɔ́tsye gie mé tóŋ lê safii, mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê kalesendonia, mbɔ́ɔntè lekùɔ, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê emelod,
en: The foundations of the city wall were adorned with every kind of jewel:   the first foundation is jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,

ngiemboon: mbɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̂a mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê saanduhane, mbɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê koonaline, mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê kelisolite, mbɔ́ɔntè lefɔ̌ɔn, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê mbelii, mbɔ́ɔntè lepfwɔʼɔ́, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê topáze, mbɔ́ɔntè legém, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê kelizopaaze, mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ lé legém, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê yasɛnte, mbɔ́ɔntè tsɔ̀b pʉ̀a lé legém, mé lɔg ntí gie mé tóŋ lê ametísè.
en: the fifth sardonyx, the sixth carnelian, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, the twelfth amethyst.

ngiemboon: Mencwònkáʼ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém, é laa metɔgɔ́tsye ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém, é ntí gie e fɔ́g tɛʼ, mbɔɔ wɛ̌ ncwònkáʼ wɔ́ɔ, é gwɔ́ mbà mé la lɔg pɔ́ tàʼa tɔgɔ́tsye na yɛ̌ ntí ńnyɛte. Alǎŋ yelÿò gie á tɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ, á gwɔ́ mbà mé lɔgɔ́ ngɔ̂ɔ té lɔ̌ʼ ńdɔg ḿbwóon, á tele tele páʼ ngalásè la.
en: The twelve gates are twelve pearls; each individual gate was made of a single pearl. The main street   of the city was pure gold, transparent as glass.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, n ké ńdíe tÿǒsoŋ ntsèm n te jʉʼʉ ssé wó gyá, á nue jʉʼʉ Ssé ye tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́, á gwɔ̌ pɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé Ngàŋa Tʉ̀ Ntsèm, mbɔɔ Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò.
en: I did not see a temple in it, because the Lord God the Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.

ngiemboon: Shʉ́shÿɔ́g Ssé ne ńkyɛʼɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, akyɛ̀ʼ ye múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò gíŋe ńne ńkyɛʼɛ yé. Tà yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ té gíŋe ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie nèm tʉ́a wó wɔ́, ńké te ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie saŋ kyɛʼ jʉʼ wó wɔ́.
en: The city does not need the sun or the moon to shine on it, because the glory of God illuminates it, and its lamp is the Lamb.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋo ngwòŋ ge gÿo lɔg pɔ́ kyɛ̀ʼ gie á fóo na yé, é néŋe. Mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ lɔgɔ wɔb legúʼ, ńdɔg ńtó ńnuŋe wó.
en: The nations will walk by its light,   and the kings of the earth will bring their glory into it.  # 21:24 Other mss read will bring to him the nations’ glory and honor,# 21:24 Is 49:7,23; 60:10

ngiemboon: Mencwònkáʼ ge ké nyɛ́ʼɛ, é tyé tyé fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm. Mé té láʼ jÿɔ́ʼ wɔ́, á nue nzěm ee ntěen síŋe wó wɔ́.
en: Its gates will never close by day because it will never be night there.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ lɔgɔ legúʼ lâ mekùʼ túmo túm ntsèm, é lɔg tó nuŋe wó.
en: They will bring the glory and honor of the nations into it.  ,# 21:26 Is 60:11

ngiemboon: Táʼ, atsɔ́ mmó gie apʉ̀ áa mǒ, á té gÿo tɔ́g tà kúu wó wɔ́. Tà mbɔɔ sɔɔn nyìŋ na pagÿo menò ncÿǒ, mbɔɔ na megàŋa cÿɔ̌nò. Ndàʼ pʉ̀a pie mezíŋ mɔ́b ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne legwɔ́ wó ye Múɔ Njʉ̀njÿò ge láʼ kúu wó.
en: Nothing unclean will ever enter it,   nor anyone who does what is detestable or false, but only those written in the Lamb’s book of life.  # 21:27 Rv 3:5; 13:8; 17:8; 20:12,15
